newsitem.title: USA: FHLMC sets $1.07 billion of REMICs.
newsitem.headline: FHLMC sets $1.07 billion of REMICs.

text.p: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac or FHLMC) said it issued more than $1.07 billion of Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC) securities.

REMIC 1895, underwritten by DLJ Securities Inc, has a coupon of 7.5 percent and is backed by $200 million of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, Freddie Mac said. It priced September 5 and has a settlement date of September 30, the agency said. The issue has a weighted average maturity of 358 months, a weighted average coupon of 8.125 percent, a weighted average loan age of two and a prepayment speed estimated at 155 by the Public Securities Association (PSA).
REMIC 1898, underwritten by DLJ, is backed by callable pass-through series C26 and has a prepayment speed estimated at 155 by the PSA, Freddie Mac said.

C26, underwritten by DLJ, has a coupon of 7.5 percent and is backed by $200 million of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, Freddie Mac said. The issue priced on September 10 and has a settlement date of October 29, FHLMC said.

REMIC 1899, underwritten by Bear Stearns & Co Inc, has a coupon of 8.0 percent and is backed by about $472 million of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, Freddie Mac said. The issue has a weighted average coupon of 8.5 percent, a weighted average maturity of 356 months, a weighted average loan age of 4, and a prepayment speed estimated at 185 by the PSA. The issue priced on September 10 and has a settlement date of September 30, the agency said.
